Recall the parametric family from the previous part, and consider the Bayesian model

$$
\begin{aligned}
\theta &\sim \text{Gamma}(a_0,\,b_0) \\
x_i\,|\, \theta &\overset{\text{iid}}{\sim }F(x;\,\theta).
\end{aligned}
$$

a. Derive the posterior distribution $p(\theta\,|\,x_{1:n})$;
b. Show that the posterior mean $E(\theta\,|\,x_{1:n})$ can be written as a convex combination of the prior mean and the MLE;
c. Derive the posterior predictive distribution $p(x_{n+1}\,|\,x_{1:n})$.
